body_html: @karlrupp, @bhack The tensorflow approach is to rely on a hardware abstraction (the tensor module) for the majority of the operations needed in by a typical neural network, while relying on specialized libraries (such as cudnn) for the few operations that are really critical performance wise. The hardware abstraction enables us to implement most TensorFlow operations once and have them run on an accelerator with more than good enough performance.
